reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first trip to Long Island since we moved to Florida 31 years ago.We picked the Residence inn because of it's location and good reviews from Trip Advisior.The hotel was clean and well maintained.The room was spacious with a full kitchen and living area.we enjoyed the indoor pool and hot tub.Every morning there was a free breakfast and some evenings a social hour with beer , wine and snacks.There were a large movie complex and restaurants within walking distance of the hotel.The staff was great.we
reviews.title: Great place to stay and great location.

reviews.text: were very happy with our stay.
reviews.title: Very Nice!

reviews.text: I stayed at this Residence Inn on Saturday, July 3, 2010. I have to say that I loved it! First, the front desk clerk, whose name I did not get, was extremely polite and friendly. She was also the front desk clerk upon checkout. Since I got to Long Island early, they let me check in at 1:00. I requested a first floor room and got it. The room was extremely immaculate. The shower curtains looked brand new but I knew they had been washed as they smell like that fresh clean laundry smell. I was in room 117, which was near an exit, making it convenient to my car. The room also had an LCD TV that was either 32" or larger. Although the hotel is not new, the room felt new. I absolutely loved it. It was also quiet, but you do hear when someone runs the water, but then again, send me to a place that you can't hear a thing. The hotel also has a movie theater within walking distance, a Chili's restaurant and a Charlie Brown's. There was also another place but I can't remember the name.
reviews.title: Sara Rivera - Hotel Front Desk

reviews.text: The only drawback that I found was that the channel lineup on the TV was very limited. You basically have to pay to watch TV. I've stayed at other area Marriott hotels and had a great channel lineup. Also, the breakfast area was quite small and it was crowded. They did have good choices for breakfast. I had eggs and sausages and a bagel and coffee, all pretty decent.
reviews.title: Fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would definitely stay here again, but only if I plan to stay for 2 or more days. I chose this hotel because it was the only hotel available for my last minute trip and I will only stay at a Marriott quality hotel or higher. I can't believe the few negative reviews that I read here. I think people who can't get their way or complain to get something free and then don't, embellish the truth. I know people like that, especially the person who had an issue with the girl whose clothes were revealing. Sounds like the boyfriend/husband may have been checking her out. If I ever encounter an issue like that, I will definitely let everyone know.
reviews.title: PHENOMENAL

reviews.text: I spent four days here in September. The hotel is located within an area flanked by several restaurants (Chili's, Charley Brown's, Wendy's) and the large Island 16 movie complex. It is a little tricky to get there but with a GPS it can be done. The hotel is four stories and has been kept up quite well. The one bedroom queen suite I stayed in had been recently remodeled. It consists of a sofa bed, separate bedroom area, and two tvs. I slept well every night I was there and there was no noise in the halls. The kitchen is somewhat reduced from other Residence Inns but still doable. The front desk staff are generally very helpful. One older lady with short blonde hair was particularly helpful in directing me to some of the sites in the area. They have a small business center with a free computer that functions well. The fitness center is small but up to date and seldom was crowded when I was there. The breakfast buffet in the morning consists of a wide variety of selections and different forms of eggs and sausages were available every night. On Tuesday and Wednesdays they offer a free dinner which consists of some pasta, meatballs, salad and soda. For tightwads like me it hit the spot and they kept filling the entrees often. Housekeeping staff on the third floor far end where I stayed was more than helpful and did a great job tidying up the place. The rate for the time I stayed there was $ 144 for a single person which is high by national standards but reasonable for the area. All and all this is a great place.
reviews.title: Very Nice Place and Good Location in Long Island

reviews.text: We chose it for its convenience to Islip MacArthur Airport and because it offers two separate sleeping rooms, a bedroom for parents and a living room with fold-out couch for teenage daughter. The one thing it didn't have -- which families who use Embassy Suites, for example, always appreciate -- is the bathroom located between the two rooms. So the living room occupant wanting to use the bathroom at night has to enter the bedroom. Not a major problem, though, and this hotel was extremely comfortable. The price included a very good brealfast and is a pretty good value for a Metro New York/Long Island location. This was a just a quick one-night stopover, so we didn't investigate all the amenities.
reviews.title: Excellent choice for families requiring privacy

reviews.text: I had expected little from a chain hotel in a commercial setting but was pleasantly surprised. The rooms were spacious, clean and well-thought-out. There was a fully equipped kitchen and even a gift of a bag of popcorn for the microwave. The amenities were the best I had had in any hotel of it's type. The complimentary breakfast spread was fresh and delicious. We were all more than satisfied with our stay, from my 93 year-old Dad (handicap accessible room) to my one-year-old granddaughter (cozy port-a-crib at no extra charge).
reviews.title: Surprisingly warm and hospitable staff

reviews.text: Good job Marriott.
reviews.title: Great Place, Great Service

reviews.text: This hotel was a terrific. The room was great, service was excellent. The breakfast was good and the front desk was very helpful. We would stay here again.
reviews.title: Great hotel for long business stays

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I walked into the Residence inn to check in on Friday night and waited while the front desk clerk was on the phone. Clearly she could use some help with manners because she did not know how to speak to people. Furthermore, I could not believe what I was seeing. I was embarrassed to stand there with my husband staring at a women who's pants were entirely too low and whose shirt was not tucked in and looked trashy. I have stayed at many Marriott's in the past and if there is one thing you expect is for the people who work there to be put together and be professional. This was not the case at this hotel. Marriott needs to make sure all there employees are in uniform and know how to speak to their clients.
reviews.title: Not exactly the first thing you want to see when you walk through the door

reviews.text: We stayed here during my sister's visit to New York/Long Island. One thing is for sure...the Hotel is SPOTLESS! Quiet honestly this was the cleanest Residence Inn I have ever stayed in. As you walk through the walkway/floor you can actually smell clean carpet, bleach and you can not see any dirt at all. My friend asked for extra blankets adn they smelt clean and were still warm out of the drier...
reviews.title: Great value!

reviews.text: The rooms are very spacious, kitchens and bathrooms are very clean. The matress is not as bad as others say, what do you expect, it's a Residence Inn not a Four Seasons. Comfortable and serves the purpose. We had a one bedroom Suite, separate bedroom and living room, 2 TV's 1 in each room.
reviews.title: Clean, friendly staff, convenient

reviews.text: The breakfast is great, eggs, sausage, waffle station, yogurt, fruits, pastry, coffee and juices. More than you can ask for.
reviews.title: Residence Inn. Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: They have a nice size pool and whirpool-unfortunately we did not get a chance to try it out. One more extra-free parking.
reviews.title: Very nice experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The worst part of our hotel stay was the mattress. It was so uncomfortable it prevented a good night's sleep. The other major problem was the air conditioner never fully cooled the rooms. A minor problem was the tv was old - didn't have great reception. The bathroom was clean but seem dated. Although we were Marriott rewards members our request for a high-floor was not honored.
reviews.title: Not a Great Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the plus side, the room was clean and quiet. They gave us an upgrade from studio to a one bedroom suite. The suite was fairly large and roomy. The staff was very friendly.
reviews.title: Happy in Holtsville

reviews.text: This was our first stay in a Residence Inn..would definitely recommend Marriott's Springhill Suites which are about the same price but from my experience newer and more comfortable than the Residence Inn.
reviews.title: OK FOR A GETAWAY-BETTER FOR FAMILIES

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first time I stayed at this property was about 4 years ago when it had just opened. I am impressed that they managed to keep it looking brand new. The carpet was clean enough to walk on barefooted! The rest of the room was immaculate as well.That almost never happens! The indoor pool was a nice treat. We saw a lot of kids that seemed to be there with their parents for some kind of sports competition but they were not ill-behaved or roaming the halls.
reviews.title: An Enjoyable Stay

likes.liked: — Comfort and cleanliness of the suite

reviews.title: nice hotel near cristiano's pizza best food I'v had in long island
reviews.text: The breakfast was wonderful with eggs and potatoes served daily, along with a nice variety of breads, fruit, yogurt, make your own waffle... you name it. The full kitchen was handy when we re-heated some leftovers for dinner one night.
